titleStmt.title: A journal of the Siege of Mentz under the command of his serene high[ness] the Duke of Lorrain, and the confederate princes. Who attack'd that important place on the 21. of June, and took it on the 31. of August, in the year, 1689. With all the bravery, courage, resolution and prudence, as ever has been shewn in any nation. Written in the German tongue by an eminent officer, and translated into English from a manuscript sent to His Majesty, King William, of Great Britain.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for R. Bentley, and are to be sold by R. Baldwin, in the Old-Baily,

notesStmt.note: In the imprint, the 'y' in 'Old-Baily' is upside-down.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
